name: St. Jerome

locations.description: Monk and biblical scholar in Bethlehem

summary: Jerome was a priest, biblical scholar, and translator who produced the Vulgate, the Latin translation of the Bible that became the standard version in the Western Church for over a millennium. He wrote extensively on Scripture, theology, and Christian life, and is considered one of the four original Doctors of the Church.
keyQuotes: Ignorance of Scripture is ignorance of Christ.
